intro: Hieracium andrzejowskii, commonly known as the Andrzejowski's hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Central and Eastern Europe, it thrives in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm and produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and botanical gardens.
